intro: Pouzolzia nudiflora, commonly known as the nakedflower pouzolzia, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Polygonaceae family, which includes plants such as buckwheat and sorrel. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and small, inconspicuous flowers that appear before the leaves in early spring. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in wetlands and along stream banks. Its botanical features make it an important component of riparian ecosystems.
